content: chequamegon hat designed by lisa dussault knitmomwi handmade designed on the shore of lake owen in the chequamegon national forest one chilly august day knit in bulky weight yarn with a garter stitch band this hat is very stretchy and can accommodate a large range of head sizes making it a good choice for charity knitting the texture makes it a good choice for hand painted or handspun yarns sizes s 16-18 m 18-20 l 20-22 materials 90 to 120 yds bulky yarn needles us 8 & 10 or size needed to obtain gauge gauge 3 5 sts per inch stitches used k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together cast-on 56 60 64 with smaller needles join to knit in round work garter stitch k one round purl one round for 2 2 25 2 5 change to larger needles rounds 1 through 3 knit round 4 purl round 5 knit round 6 purl continue working these 6 rounds until hat measures 6 5 6 75 7 from cast-on edge ending with round 3 or 6 measure with the hat slightly stretched medium only decrease 4sts k 13 k2tog x 4 56 sts remain begin crown decreases large 1 k6 k2tog repeat to end 8sts decreased 2 knit rounds 2 4 6 8 begin decreases for medium & small 3 k5 k2tog repeat to end 8sts decreased 5 k4 k2tog repeat to end 8sts decreased 7 k3 k2tog repeat to end 8sts decreased 9 k2 k2tog repeat to end 8sts decreased 10 k1 k2tog repeat to end 8sts decreased 11 k2tog repeat to end 8sts decreased cut yarn and draw end through remaining 8 stitches weave in ends and block if you enjoyed this pattern please consider knitting a hat for someone in need of warmth thank-you to the generous knitters who offered to test this hat
